sentences.english: The fresh boy is always bullied by seniors at school.
sentences.chinese: 那个新来的男孩在学校里总是被学长欺负。

sentences.english: Heh - heh - heh, I got the whole info from the upperclassman.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，我从学长那儿得到了所有的消息。

sentences.english: This time I use master's knives, much easier to use!
sentences.chinese: 用大师学长的刀刻得，的确比上一个要深很多。

sentences.english: At the ceremony, was surprised to find the rain shine fiss unexpectedly is his senior.
sentences.chinese: 在婚礼现场，雨晴吃惊地发现颜飞竟然是自己的学长。

sentences.english: We are all old actually are too quickly intelligent too late, my school leader last year mourning wife.
sentences.chinese: 我们都老得太快却聪明得太迟，我的学长去年丧妻。

sentences.english: The seniors can give me pieces of advice on life and study.
sentences.chinese: 学长学姐们可以给我很多学习和生活方面的建议。

sentences.english: Here, I would like to thank the club for their sister school students.
sentences.chinese: 在这里，我想感谢俱乐部的学长学姐们。

sentences.english: The students from the upper classes gave Fang a warm welcome and helped her to carry her luggage.
sentences.chinese: 高年级的学长们热情地迎接她的到来，并帮她拿行李。

sentences.english: Prof. Chan affirmed the value of alumni mentoring.
sentences.chinese: 陈教授对学长培导计划的价值予以肯定。

sentences.english: Students also have some problems on learning to students consult.
sentences.chinese: 同学们也就一些学习上的问题向学长们请教。

sentences.english: Seniors swoop in as young chicks enter their first year in college.
sentences.chinese: 小妞们刚开始大学第一年的生活，学长们就乘虚而入。

sentences.english: Hey, I got all the information from the upperclassmen.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，我从学长们那里拿到所有的资料了。

sentences.english: Hey, I got the whole info from the upperclassman.
sentences.chinese: 喂，我已经从学长那里拿到所有的资料了。

sentences.english: Now red teacher but tell her, she can act as total seniors?
sentences.chinese: 现或赤老师却告诉她，她能担任总学长？

sentences.english: So Li bought two secondhand books from him.
sentences.chinese: 于是他就从这位学长那里买了两本二手书。

definition: to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
the most handsome boy in the school (see also 校花[xiao4 hua1])
senior male fellow student or apprentice/son (older than oneself) of one's teacher
